text: Mailufterl is an Austrian nickname for the first computer working solely on transistors on the European mainland. It was built in 1955 at the Vienna University of Technology by Heinz Zemanek. The builder plays on a quote on an operating computer: "If it is not the rapid calculation speed of American models that Whirlwind or Typhoon can achieve, it will be enough for a Wiener Mailufterl". The full name is Binar dezimaler Volltransistor-Rechenautomat. Hoibuflel pr sen Aw%ion niAnome fon k hrt compule werhiny sslely on knsuleay on b ewropesn mainlon! U wos buiUI xn 195F of lb Wenw Lnivesily of Henz Zenonek. Th buildu ploys9n myon comple: u R 2f ts nof H rqpio1 <leulixn sped of Amriwor modl, loh widwind e T7poon wn oIiwvenLwU be enoyl f Kor Wee Moihferl^. Te RU nome is Bunor deximole Vollorter - khnsubomch
